attributes.action: Allow freehold home owners to opt out of Private Estate management companies
attributes.additional_details: Because I believe that Councils have negated their responsibilities by allowing house builders to use Section 106 as a means to obtain Planning Permission from Local Councils Planning Departments, and for councils to get income/revenue from home buyers via top rate banded council tax for little involvement in Estate Maintenance, service roads and general day to day management of new estates.
attributes.background: To give freehold home owners the absolute right of opting out of restrictive management companies and to make local councils accountable for such estate developments, and scrap section 106.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you'd like a right to opt-out of estate management contracts, but we're not sure from your petition how this relates to Section 106. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
